fko.chessly.player

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • fko.chessly.mvc.ModelObservable
        • fko.chessly.player.AbstractPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends ModelObservable
implements Player, java.util.Observer

    This class is the abstract core implementation of a Chessly player. It implements the thread handling and getters to fields.

    A player has always a certain state: WAITING, THINKING, HAS_MOVE, STOPPED

    This class is thread safe!

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractPlayer.PlayerStatusController
      This extends a StatusController to control legal status changes by overriding the checkTransition method and defining legal transition there.

    • Method Detail

      • startPlayerPrepare

        protected void startPlayerPrepare()
        This method may be overwritten to do some extra stuff when startPlayer() is called and before the actual Thread is started.

      • startPlayer

        public void startPlayer(Game game)
        Starts the player in a new thread. Calls setCurrentGame() to set the game reference as the current game of this player.
        Specified by:
        startPlayer in interface Player

      • stopPlayer

        public void stopPlayer()
        Stop the player by interrupting the players thread and setting its status to Player.STOPPED
        Specified by:
        stopPlayer in interface Player

      • joinPlayerThread

        public void joinPlayerThread()
        Wait until the player thread dies. Ignores InterruptedException.
        Specified by:
        joinPlayerThread in interface Player

      • run

        public void run()
        The worker method for Runnable. Does the actual playing by calling getMove() and handling the different status a player can be in.
        It loops until the player is stopped (Player.STOPPED).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getNextMove

        public GameMove getNextMove(GameBoard board)
        Return next move by waiting for a move given by the player thread in run().
        This is usually called from a game object when it is this player's turn.
        It sets the player's status to Player.THINKING and waits for a move (Player.HAS_MOVE) through calling waitForState(Player.HAS_MOVE). The move will be returned and the player will be set to status Player.WAITING.
        Specified by:
        getNextMove in interface Player
        Parameters:
        board - where the next move shall be made
        Returns:
        the move the player wants to play for the given board

      • getCurrentGame

        public Game getCurrentGame()
        Returns the current game the player is in.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentGame in interface Player
        Returns:
        current game

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        A Player acts as an observer to the game. This method should be overwritten by the subclasses to actually process the updates if needed.
        In this implementation this method does nothing at all.
        This method is called whenever the observed object is changed. An application calls an Observable object's notifyObservers method to have all the object's observers notified of the change.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - the observable object.
        arg - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method.
